answers.answer: Ive been induced with all my babies its been quick and easy..my first they started at 8:30am my daughter was born at 2:14pm. My second was about 2 hours longer and my last one I was sent to the hospital at 2:30pm and they started pitocin he was born right after 5pm. :) its not as bad as people say but I definitely recommend the epidural if your not trying to go natural.
Why are you getting induced early? I'd avoid it if at all possible.

I have gestational diabetes which makes me a high risk pregnancy. So the Perinatologist I go too thinks it would be safer for me and the baby to be induced at 39 weeks instead of waiting for him to come on his own.

I was induced with my daughter and I had np at all! I love it bc they get u in at a certain time and I was in labor for 4 hours and pusjed for 5 min and sje was out. They put that mineral stuff on my hooha so I never ripped and I had an epidural.  Thank God for that! It was a great experience.  Don't worry just make sure u get that epidural if u don't want to go natural! Good luck momma! (:

I was induced with my second after 41wks and will be induced with my third early thanks to complications. My induction was a breeze labor and delivery totalled two hours fifteen minutes. I did tear, but I tore with my first as well, to me that was the worst part of the delivery since my epidural didn't work... She was 8lb 1oz, 19 3/4in

I was induced early with my son and I had a beautiful delivery.  The only thing was my son was sunny side up and the back labor was hell.  I was in active labour for 4h pushed once and he was bornI'm going to try to go until this one is ready on its own.  My dr only let's his mommas go to 40+3

question: I always assumed I would go in to labor naturally when my baby boy was ready but at my appointment yesterday they said they want me to deliver at 39 weeks. I'm 37w4d now. Can you ladies give me some of your induction stories???
title: well crap....
